result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Baratki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA'S are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must not be on any suboxone, xanax, valium or any addictive medications. Must provide agent with release and get agents approval prior to filing any prescriptions. Must attend 5 self-help meetings per week during the first month of probation. Must provide proof of same to agent. No contact with victim without agent approval and approval of victim. Contact with victim must be initially in compliance with family court orders. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Firearm warning given.

timeConds.notes: Must participate in the substance abuse program in Racine County Jail. Once the program is complete, the balance of the jail time will be stayed.
